titleStmt.title: H. B. Marrs et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5876

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned subscribers would most respectfully state to the Honable Thomas E. Bramlette Govr. of the State of Kentucky that on the 28th day of September 1863 Daniel Pickerel was held by an examining court of Monroe County, on a charge of Larceny to appear in the Monroe Circuit Court, or Monroe Equity & criminal court to answer Said charge. That he was allowed to give bail in the sum of fifty Dollars for his appearance in court to answer the charge to An indictment was W. S. Maxey, Thomas Pickerel, Lendel Hagan, T. M. Copass W. D. Page & J. F. Walden went in his bond as his surety (in his said bond) An indictment was found against Daniel Pickerel on Said charge by the Monroe Circuit court in April 1864. And a forfeiture taken on his bond against his sureties because he failed to appear in said court. Daniel Pickerel Joined the 37th Regiment of mounted infantry vols. of Kentucky. after the bond was given and before the Indictment was found and was in the service of the army of the United States when the bond was forfeited and was still in same regiment in October 1864 when Judgment was rendered against the securities and is yet serving as a soldier in 37th Reg. of Infantry vols. of Kentucky. We pray you, Governor to intercede in their behalf and release them from the payment of said Judgment. This the 26th day of October 1864.

H. B. Marrs clerk of Monroe Circuit Court
L,, A,, Smithwick Clk. Cty Court
J B Evans
Thomas Evans
Bennett Spear s,m,c
Henry EadesP J J

Monroe Cir Ct
vs
W S Maxey &
others
of $50,
remitted
31st Oct/64
